DEGASI1.name: Underwater Degasi Base
DEGASI1.pda: A PDA recording of a conversation between two Degasi survivors, arguing about the prospects of building a new seabase 500 meters underwater, in a different area of the crater
DEGASI1.databox: A databox containing the blueprint for the ultra-high capacity oxygen tank
DEGASI1.water: A machine for filtering salt from water, from which the blueprint has been scanned
DEGASI1.breathcharge: Fragments of a machine to recharge liquid breathing systems
DEGASI1.azurite: Densely compacted azurite formed into a crystalline composite

JELLYSHROOM.name: Jellyshroom Caves
JELLYSHROOM.mushroom: Large, glowing, mushroom-like flora, home to a predator in symbiosis
JELLYSHROOM.magnetite: Deposits of the mineral magnetite, likely formed from volcanic activity
JELLYSHROOM.degasi: The decaying remains of a seabase, once inhabited by the survivors of the Degasi

POD3.name: Northern Kelp Forest
POD3.databox: A databox containing the blueprint for a compass
POD3.geyser: A cave south of lifepod 3 containing an undersea geyser, several broken Nanolathing Drones, and extremely high numbers of both Crashfish and Drooping Stingers

POD19.name: Sparse Reef Fissures
POD19.pda: A PDA containing a reprimand from First Officer Keen, and coordinates to a rendezvous on dry land
POD19.cycfire: A databox containing the blueprint for an integrated fire suppression module for large submersibles
POD19.console: A databox for a moonpool installation, for crafting and installing vehicle upgrades
POD19.databox: A databox containing the blueprint for the ultra-high capacity oxygen tank
POD19.cache: An alien structure containing a number of Ion Cubes and little usable information
POD19.vent: A strange vent of alien design, periodically ingesting and then expelling peepers, seemingly causing them to trail glowing sparkles after being emitted

POD17.name: Western Grassy Plateaus
POD17.pda: Ozzy (from the cafeteria) lamenting his fear of the environment outside his lifepod, the situation he finds himself in, and the apparent lack of attempts to rescue Aurora personnel
POD17.seamoth: Fragments of Seamoth submersibles, dispersed during the impact of a portion of the Aurora’s Seamoth hangar
POD17.jelly: A cavernous biome comprised primarily of pink, mushroomlike flora and predatory eels
POD17.room: A difficult-to-access chamber in a piece of Aurora wreckage filled with a multitude of technology fragments

POD6.name: Eastern Grassy Plateaus
POD6.pda: A pda detailing the fate of the aurora survivors aboard lifepod 6, who died in an explosion due to haphazard use of a flare
POD6.seacrown: A rare specimen of alien flora, remarkable for its internal bacterial colonies
POD6.salve: A species of red flora, the leaves of which are coated in oils that have medicinal properties

KOOSH.name: Bulb Zone
KOOSH.pda: A log from a fraudulent and unqualified doctor forseeing his own demise
KOOSH.mushkoosh: A convoluted cave connecting the Mushroom Forest and Bulb Zone, and home to a unique species of chemosynthetic coral
KOOSH.mercury: Geologically active caves containing cinnabar ore
KOOSH.reinf: A databox containing the blueprint for the Reinforced Dive Suit, accessible only via traversing a wreck
KOOSH.arch: A strange alien arch hidden in a small cave, in the deeper reaches of the biome

DUNECENTRAL.name: The Dunes
DUNECENTRAL.reaper: Large, muscular, predatory leviathans, which make use of echolocation to search for prey, which they grip with large mandibles
DUNECENTRAL.shroom: Blue mushroom-like plants that emit light-sensitive seed pods
DUNECENTRAL.azurite: Abundant deposits of the volatile mineral Azurite around thermal vents
DUNECENTRAL.suit: A databox for the Electrochemical Suit, deep inside a large wreck, in a room only accessible via a partially-collapsed duct system
DUNECENTRAL.vent: A strange vent of alien design, periodically ingesting and then expelling peepers, seemingly causing them to trail glowing sparkles after being emitted
DUNECENTRAL.arch: A small wreck next to a large stone arch

METEOR.name: Dunes Meteor
METEOR.meteor: The core of a large meteorite, comprised of several useful metals
METEOR.cache: An alien structure containing a number of Ion Cubes, and what seem to be the memories of an alien lifeform

UNDERISLANDS.name: Underwater Islands
UNDERISLANDS.glass: A unique, hot, and dangerous biome in the trench under the main underwater islands biome
UNDERISLANDS.piezo: Strange, buoyant crystals that will occasionally emit powerful electromagnetic blasts that disrupt nearby electrical systems
UNDERISLANDS.wreck: A large wreck from the aurora, a piece of which broke off and fell into the depths before it could be explored
UNDERISLANDS.farmer: A databox containing the blueprint for an automated harvesting device, separated from the main wreck and pinned underneath debris
UNDERISLANDS.databox: A databox containing the blueprint for an integrated fire suppression module for large submersibles
UNDERISLANDS.room: A room containing a number of databoxes, originally blocked by a dislodged titanium door

BKELPTRENCH.name: Blood Kelp Trench Base
BKELPTRENCH.pda: A long information-dense rant from the occupant of Lifepod 1, recorded some time after they crashed in this location; details their potential escape routes and the obstacles therein, as well as some of their attempted solutions
BKELPTRENCH.pod1: The remains of Lifepod 1, underneath a large, derelict seabase, and a recording of the pod’s violent entry into the planetary atmosphere and then the ocean
BKELPTRENCH.chit: Firmware upgrades to overclock the Bioprocessor, increasing energy efficiency by 25%
BKELPTRENCH.databox: A databox containing the blueprint for substantial upgrades to the Seamoth’s depth rating, far beyond the typical design envelope

NBKELP.name: Northern Blood Kelp
NBKELP.pod2: The remains of Aurora lifepod 2, which failed to deploy flotation devices and promptly sunk to the seafloor; The survivors then attempted to escape this extreme depth with no breathing apparatus
NBKELP.cache: An alien structure containing a number of Ion Cubes, and a terminal with data indicating a possible function of these caches
NBKELP.nest: A nest for [unfinished] tucked inside a large cave
NBKELP.levi: An ethereal, hammer-headed, adolescent leviathan that makes use of forceful ramming to repel competitors to its territory, but which in fact feeds on microscopic lifeforms in the water

LOSTRIVER.name: Lost River
LOSTRIVER.pda: A PDA audio log, appearing to record the destruction of a seamoth by the leviathan near where it was found
LOSTRIVER.arch: A strange alien arch hidden in a small cave behind a brinefall in the Ghost Forest
LOSTRIVER.drf: A destroyed precursor facility with many long-dead biological specimens, and extensive information on multiple organisms found on 4546B
LOSTRIVER.cache: A small biological research outpost tucked into a cave wall, by a large skeleton of a now-extinct creature; contained a genetic terminal where the upload of human data provided basic insights into Kharaa treatment
LOSTRIVER.skull: An extremely large skull and upper ribcage of an ancient creature dwarfing anything encountered on the planet
LOSTRIVER.sulfur: Large deposits of pure, crystalline sulfur, exposed by surrounding caustic brine
LOSTRIVER.seal: A damaged seamoth upgrade for reducing power leakage to the environment
LOSTRIVER.dragon: The skeleton of a Sea Dragon Leviathan; Many bones appear to have been fractured or broken in a high velocity impact
LOSTRIVER.levi: Ethereal, hammer-headed, juvenile leviathans that make use of forceful ramming to hunt their prey; Highly aggressive

DRF.name: Disease Research Facility
DRF.terminal1: A download of alien biological and paleontological data, pertaining to various species on 4546b, both extant and extinct
DRF.damage: A download of alien black box data, detailing how the facility was destroyed through the actions of an enraged Sea Dragon
DRF.tablet: A broken, flickering white tablet, similar to other previously encountered tablets, inside the skeleton of a large research specimen
DRF.cycheat: A download of alien technological data that has been adapted into a heat rejection upgrade for the Cyclops
DRF.disease: A download of alien historical data pertaining to the nature and origins of the “Kharaa” bacterium
DRF.egg: The preserved egg of a Sea Dragon Leviathan
DRF.warper: Various body parts belonging to Warpers

LAVACASTLE.name: Lava Castle
LAVACASTLE.kyanite: Collectible kyanite crystals, formed via high levels of volcanic activity
LAVACASTLE.tablet: A pristine, sky-blue tablet, certain to be similar in function to other alien tablets
LAVACASTLE.ion: A download of alien technological data, adapted into blueprints for ion cube-based batteries
LAVACASTLE.tap: A download of alien structural data, indicating how to tap into the energy running through alien structures

CRAG.name: Crag Field
CRAG.pod7: The remains of Lifepod 7; Its fabricator appears to have malfunctioned during evacuation
CRAG.scoop: A databox containing the blueprint for a phytoplankton collection module
CRAG.arch: A strange alien arch hidden in a small cave

FLOATISLAND.name: Floating Island
FLOATISLAND.degasi: A number of derelict seabases, once occupied by the survivors of the Degasi
FLOATISLAND.keen: The last known location of First Officer Keen, and a pda detailing his encounter with Yu, the only other Aurora survivor who appeared to survive for any length of time
FLOATISLAND.arch: A strange alien arch hidden within a cave
FLOATISLAND.floater: Giant versions of the buoyant floater organisms encountered attached to some rocks, holding the entire landmass afloat

MOUNTAINISLAND.name: Mountain Island
MOUNTAINISLAND.gun: A towering structure, of unknown design and purpose
MOUNTAINISLAND.beachpda: A PDA from a group of Aurora survivors, documenting their arrival on the island from a location to the east and their discoveries of various structures, items, topography, and lifeforms on the island
MOUNTAINISLAND.cavepda: A PDA from an Aurora survivor, paranoid and desperate about their circumstances, and making note of the fates of their fellow survivors, as well as describing a red alien device they threw away at the eastern end of the island
MOUNTAINISLAND.arch: An alien teleporter, leading to a corresponding structure in a cave on a floating island
MOUNTAINISLAND.battery: A damaged, malfunctioning battery made from Azurite-based materials
MOUNTAINISLAND.tablet: A shattered, red tablet of non-human design
MOUNTAINISLAND.plantalcove: A small skylit alcove in the above-water cave system, host to a new species of plant not encountered anywhere else on 4546B
MOUNTAINISLAND.campfire: A sleeping mat and campfire left over from one of the aurora survivors that made it to the island; the campfire can be used to smoke fish to preserve it without the use of salt

GUN.name: Quarantine Enforcement Platform
GUN.cube: Glowing green cubes containing immense ionic energy
GUN.denied: A strange alien terminal, the attempted usage of which was denied for reasons of infection, and revealed the true purpose of the containing structure
GUN.jailbreak: A download of what appears to be alien malware, making the laser cutter capable of stripping salvage from the hull of the aurora Reminder from Alterra: Salvage of the Aurora is illegal under Transgovernmental law

FLOATDEGASI.name: Island Degasi Wrecks
FLOATDEGASI.main: A PDA from Degasi survivor Paul Torgal, detailing the group’s situation five weeks after crashing, and exhibiting arrogant certainty of their ability to survive on 4546B
FLOATDEGASI.outside: A PDA recording of a conversation between two Degasi survivors, mentioning plans to build a new seabase in a mineral-rich cavern
FLOATDEGASI.return: A PDA from Degasi survivor Bart Torgal, appearing to contain some of his last words before succumbing to infection, seemingly recorded long after the deaths of both Paul Torgal and Marguerit Maida, and after a return from an unknown deep location
FLOATDEGASI.init: A PDA recording of a conversation between recording of a conversation between the Degasi survivors, documenting their arrival on the island and subsequent predicament regarding food and shelter

DUNEARCH.name: Dunes Arch
DUNEARCH.pda: A PDA found within wreckage, detailing the fate of an Aurora crewmember who was unable to board an escape pod, but managed to survive the initial impact of the Aurora
DUNEARCH.reaper: Large, muscular, predatory leviathans, which make use of echolocation to search for prey, which they grip with large mandibles
DUNEARCH.liqbr: A databox containing the blueprints for a liquid breathing system

GRANDREEF.name: Grand Reef
GRANDREEF.platinum: Elemental platinum, unearthed by the titanic footsteps of the Sea Treaders
GRANDREEF.poo: The waste products of Sea Treaders, which may serve as useful biochemical feedstock into various processes
GRANDREEF.sealed: A databox containing the blueprint for watertight, electrically insulative fabric
GRANDREEF.levi: Ethereal, hammer-headed, adolescent leviathans that make use of forceful ramming to repel competitors to their territory, but which in fact feed on microscopic lifeforms in the water
GRANDREEF.vent: A strange vent of alien design, periodically ingesting and then expelling peepers, seemingly causing them to trail glowing sparkles after being emitted
GRANDREEF.base: A long-abandoned seabase built by the Degasi survivors in a cave deep underwater

MUSHTREE.name: Mushroom Tree
MUSHTREE.treepda: The last words of an Aurora survivor who became trapped in the hollowed caverns of a large coral tree
MUSHTREE.chit: An installable overclock for the Laser Cutter, allowing it to carve through reinforced bulkheads
MUSHTREE.bacteria: Large colonies of bacteria, containing enzymes capable of breaking down biological matter

MUSHROOMS.name: Mushroom Disk Forests
MUSHROOMS.khasar: A recording of Jochi Khasar's violent atmospheric entry, and his reaction to the situation
MUSHROOMS.initpda: The log of an Aurora survivor, designated to rescue aurora passenger Jochi Khasar or document their fate if this proved impossible
MUSHROOMS.tree: Large fossilized remains of a mushroom tree with a complex internal cave system, in the center of the Western Mushroom Forest
MUSHROOMS.highwreck: A large fragment of the aurora, resting on top of a mushroom tree, with several technologies and audio logs related to orbital scanning
MUSHROOMS.arch: A strange alien arch hidden in a small cave, accessible from an underwater ravine in the Western Mushroom Forest
MUSHROOMS.mushkoosh: A convoluted cave connecting the Eastern Mushroom Forest and Bulb Zone, and home to a unique species of chemosynthetic coral
MUSHROOMS.vent: A strange vent of alien design, periodically ingesting and then expelling peepers, seemingly causing them to trail glowing sparkles after being emitted

MOUNTAINPOD.name: Lifepod 14
MOUNTAINPOD.podpda: A PDA recording of a conversation between a group of Aurora survivors in an overcrowded lifepod, arguing about what to do in the wake of the Aurora’s crash landing
MOUNTAINPOD.podpda2: A PDA from an Aurora survivor, detailing the fate of their lifepod and bemoaning their survival prospects after having been abandoned by the other occupants of the pod
MOUNTAINPOD.basepda: A PDA from an Aurora survivor, detailing dire circumstances as a result of surrounding leviathan activity on their attempts to traverse the area, as well as some indication of an incomplete plan for avoiding their detection; Also contains some analysis of the mineral Azurite, and speculation on where richer deposits of it can be found
MOUNTAINPOD.mask: A damaged databox containing the blueprint for a recirculation mask, wedged into a metal grille
MOUNTAINPOD.stealth: A databox containing the blueprints for an experimental noise suppression module, intended to enable evading detection by Reaper Leviathans
MOUNTAINPOD.knife: A survival knife, upgraded to sear whatever it comes into contact with
MOUNTAINPOD.battery: A databox containing the blueprint for seabase power storage expansions

TREADERPOD.name: Lifepod 9
TREADERPOD.pda: A PDA from an Aurora survivor, whose ranting was interrupted by the destruction of his lifepod
TREADERPOD.treader: Massive, bottom-dwelling leviathans, the footsteps of which both bury and unearth objects from the seafloor
TREADERPOD.platinum: Elemental platinum, unearthed by the titanic footsteps of the Sea Treaders
TREADERPOD.enzy: A damaged databox containing the chemical formula for enzymes that break down cellular structures, apparently crushed by large fauna
TREADERPOD.basepda: A PDA from an Aurora survivor, who appears to have become subject to a number of self-inflicted hardships
TREADERPOD.databox: A databox containing the blueprint for moderate upgrades to the Seamoth’s depth rating

GLASSFOREST.name: Glass Forest
GLASSFOREST.databox: A databox containing the complex chemical formula for an oxygen-bearing fluid, suitable for liquid-based respiration
GLASSFOREST.speed: A databox for a module to give the seamoth a speed boost, shoved in an air vent by the force of the crash
GLASSFOREST.deepvine: Samples taken from large, purple, kelplike flora containing potentially useful organic compounds
GLASSFOREST.levi: An ethereal, hammer-headed, adolescent leviathan that makes use of forceful ramming to repel competitors to its territory, but which in fact feeds on microscopic lifeforms in the water; This specimen is colored unusually for its species due to the unique diet the local biome provides

CRASH.name: Crash Zone
CRASH.pod4: The overturned remains of lifepod 4, containing a databox with the blueprint for decoy devices and a PDA warning of massive aggressive predators in the area
CRASH.stasis: A databox for a seabase module to freeze hostile creatures in the debris field directly behind the Aurora
CRASH.crashmesa: The remains of lifepod 10, with a nearby databox containing the blueprint for significant upgrades to the Seamoth’s depth rating
CRASH.reaper: Large, muscular, predatory leviathans, which make use of echolocation to search for prey, which they grip with large mandibles
CRASH.sanctuary: A small biome, seemingly spared from the destruction of the aurora’s impact, and home to a now-endangered flora specimen with an interesting yet familiar appearance
CRASH.trailerbase: The fragmented and partially buried wreck of a Degasi seabase, likely destroyed by the disturbance caused by the Aurora’s impact, and containing advanced materials and recipes

DEGASIEND.name: Deep Degasi Base
DEGASIEND.end: A recording of the demise of the Degasi survivors as a result of Marguerit Maida returning with an injured leviathan, attracting another which attacked the base
DEGASIEND.tablet: A broken orange tablet in the same general design of the purple variant, with unknown usage
DEGASIEND.rebreather: The final fragments to create a construction blueprint for a machine to recharge liquid breathing systems

VOID.name: Crater Edge
VOID.destroy: Audio of the final moments of lifepod 15 as it was destroyed by a Ghost Leviathan
VOID.databox: A databox containing the blueprint for tough metal plating to build advanced vehicles
VOID.spikes: A large biome, separated from the main crater by open water, comprised of floating spike-shaped chunks of rock
VOID.bubble: Strange rising spheres which can stick to vehicles and significantly impede movement

VOIDSPIKES.name: Void Spikes
VOIDSPIKES.end: A log from the occupant of lifepod 15 as they examined their limited options and discussed visiting an unknown deep region further away from the main crater
VOIDSPIKES.items: Strange crystals formed under extreme pressure, with commensurate fabrication applications
VOIDSPIKES.levi: A large, aggressive creature that makes use of light and electricity based attacks

MOUNTAINS.name: Underwater Mountains
MOUNTAINS.reaper: Large, muscular, predatory leviathans, which make use of echolocation to search for prey, which they grip with large mandibles
MOUNTAINS.azurite: Sparse deposits of the volatile mineral Azurite around thermal vents
MOUNTAINS.magnetite: Deposits of the mineral magnetite, likely formed from volcanic activity
MOUNTAINS.pyropod: Heat-emitting flora, the tough pods of which may have heat-resistant or biochemical applications
MOUNTAINS.debris: Debris from the destruction of the Sunbeam, including miscellaneous garbage, metal, mechanical parts, and rare materials from their cargo bay
MOUNTAINS.vent: A strange vent of alien design, periodically ingesting and then expelling peepers, seemingly causing them to trail glowing sparkles after being emitted
